articles.headline: Their Soil Toxic, 1,100 Indiana Residents Scramble to Find New Homes
articles.snippet: In a situation echoing the crisis in Flint, Mich., a housing complex’s poor, mostly black residents are being resettled because of high lead and arsenic levels.
articles.abstract: In a situation echoing the crisis in Flint, Mich., a housing complex’s poor, mostly black residents are being resettled because of high lead and arsenic levels.
articles.lead_paragraph: EAST CHICAGO, Ind. — Stephanie King, a single mother of five, has adopted a grim routine over the past month: mopping with bleach twice a day and sweeping even more often to remove any dirt her family might have tracked inside. She has a haunted look, and for good reason.

articles.headline: The Challenge of Cutting Coal Dependence
articles.snippet: The resistance that Germany has faced underscores the difficulty in the international effort to reduce fossil fuels in the world’s energy supply.
articles.abstract: The resistance that Germany has faced underscores the difficulty in the international effort to reduce fossil fuels in the world’s energy supply.
articles.lead_paragraph: It won’t be easy to get rid of coal.

articles.headline: Senior ISIS Strategist and Spokesman Is Reported Killed in Syria
articles.snippet: Abu Muhammad al-Adnani, who was behind the Islamic State’s call for attacks against Western interests around the world, died in Aleppo Province, the group said.
articles.abstract: Abu Muhammad al-Adnani, who was behind the Islamic State’s call for attacks against Western interests around the world, died in Aleppo Province, the group said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The senior Islamic State strategist Abu Muhammad al-Adnani was killed in northern Syria, the group announced on Tuesday, signaling the death of one of the world’s most-wanted terrorists.
articles.byline: By Eric Schmitt and Anne Barnard

articles.headline: Economists Discuss the Predictions That Divide Them
articles.snippet: The health of consumer spending, corporate profits and whether there will be a rebound in growth are some of the topics generating disparate views.
articles.abstract: The health of consumer spending, corporate profits and whether there will be a rebound in growth are some of the topics generating disparate views.
articles.lead_paragraph: What’s ahead for the American economy?

articles.headline: Fact-Checking Apple’s Claims on E.U. Tax Ruling
articles.snippet: The company’s chief executive issued a defiant letter after Ireland was ordered to collect about $14.5 billion in back taxes.
articles.abstract: The company’s chief executive issued a defiant letter after Ireland was ordered to collect about $14.5 billion in back taxes.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Timothy D. Cook, Apple’s chief executive, issued a defiant letter to his European customers on Tuesday after the region’s antitrust enforcer ordered Ireland to collect 13 billion euros, or about $14.5 billion, in back taxes from the company.

articles.headline: Donald Trump to Visit Mexico After More Than a Year of Mocking It
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump will make the trip on Wednesday to speak with President Enrique Peña Nieto, hours before he gives a speech on immigration.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump will make the trip on Wednesday to speak with President Enrique Peña Nieto, hours before he gives a speech on immigration.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump will visit Mexico on Wednesday for a private meeting with President Enrique Peña Nieto — a trip that will take him to a nation he has repeatedly scorned — before quickly flying back for what is billed as a major immigration speech in Arizona.
articles.byline: By Nick Corasaniti and Azam Ahmed

articles.headline: Court Costs Entrap Nonwhite, Poor Juvenile Offenders
articles.snippet: Fees and fines are levied on young offenders in every state but have an outsize effect on racial minorities and the poor, creating a two-tiered system of justice.
articles.abstract: Fees and fines are levied on young offenders in every state but have an outsize effect on racial minorities and the poor, creating a two-tiered system of justice.
articles.lead_paragraph: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. — When Dequan Jackson had his only brush with the law, at 13, he tried to do everything right.

articles.headline: Yesterday, Outraged by Apple’s Tax Dodge. Today, by Its Tax Bill.
articles.snippet: Lawmakers have criticized companies that avoid taxes by moving overseas. But they’re rallying to Apple’s defense after an E.U. demand for $14.5 billion in back taxes.
articles.abstract: Lawmakers have criticized companies that avoid taxes by moving overseas. But they’re rallying to Apple’s defense after an E.U. demand for $14.5 billion in back taxes.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — American lawmakers have for years been assailing companies for dodging taxes with overseas maneuvers. But now that the European Union has done something about it by trying to wrest billions of dollars from Apple, those officials have offered a response viewed by many as rife with hypocrisy: collective outrage.
